intro: Ageratum albidum var. nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's white ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, white to pale blue flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, daisy-like blooms. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
